alert.note: Alert for Powder River (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 5:39PM MDT until June 24 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following county, Powder River. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 536 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Law enforcement reported that Moorehead Road is washed out near Plum Creek. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Buttermilk Creek, Indian Creek, Cabin Creek, Flood Creek, Plum Creek, South Fork Bloom Creek, Buffalo Creek, Bloom Creek, Three Bar Creek, Powder River, Bradshaw Creek, Fire Creek, Bitter Creek, Dry Creek, Butte Creek and Bay Horse Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moorhead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places.
